Linear Equations and Inequalities.description: Solving linear equations and inequalities in one and multiple variables

Systems of Linear Equations.description: Methods for solving systems of linear equations including substitution, elimination, and matrix methods

Quadratic Equations and Functions.description: Solving quadratic equations, analyzing quadratic functions, and applications

Polynomials: Operations, Factoring, and.description: Polynomial operations, factoring techniques, and graphing polynomial functions

Exponents, Radicals, and Logarithms.description: Properties of exponents, radical expressions, and logarithmic functions

Limits.description: Concept of limits, limit laws, and continuity

Differentiation Techniques.description: Rules of differentiation, chain rule, implicit differentiation, and related rates

Integration Techniques.description: Integration by substitution, parts, partial fractions, and trigonometric substitution

Multivariable Calculus.description: Partial derivatives, multiple integrals, vector calculus, and applications

Series.description: Infinite series, convergence tests, power series, and Taylor series

Matrix Operations.description: Matrix arithmetic, determinants, and matrix inverses

Vector Spaces.description: Vector spaces, subspaces, linear independence, and basis

Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors.description: Computing eigenvalues and eigenvectors, diagonalization, and applications

Linear Transformations.description: Linear transformations, matrix representations, and change of basis

Divisibility.description: Divisibility rules, greatest common divisor, and Euclidean algorithm

Prime Numbers.description: Prime factorization, distribution of primes, and primality testing

Modular Arithmetic.description: Congruences, modular arithmetic, and applications to cryptography

Diophantine Equations.description: Integer solutions to polynomial equations and Pell equations

Probability Concepts.description: Basic probability, sample spaces, and probability rules

Discrete Distributions.description: Binomial, geometric, Poisson, and other discrete probability distributions

Continuous Distributions.description: Normal, exponential, uniform, and other continuous probability distributions

Central Limit Theorem.description: Central limit theorem, sampling distributions, and statistical inference

Markov Chains.description: Discrete-time Markov chains, transition matrices, and steady-state behavior

Sequences and Series.description: Convergence of sequences and series, tests for convergence

Continuity.description: Continuous functions, uniform continuity, and properties

Differentiability.description: Derivatives, mean value theorem, and applications

Riemann Integration.description: Riemann sums, fundamental theorem of calculus, and integration theory

Metric Spaces.description: Metric spaces, completeness, compactness, and connectedness

Group Theory.description: Groups, subgroups, homomorphisms, and group actions

Ring Theory.description: Rings, ideals, quotient rings, and polynomial rings

Field Theory.description: Field extensions, algebraic and transcendental elements

Galois Theory.description: Galois groups, solvability by radicals, and applications

Analytic Functions.description: Complex differentiability, Cauchy-Riemann equations, and holomorphic functions

Contour Integration.description: Complex integration, Cauchy's theorem, and residue calculus

Conformal Mapping.description: Conformal transformations and applications to boundary value problems

Riemann Surfaces.description: Multi-valued functions, branch cuts, and Riemann surfaces

First Order ODEs.description: Separable equations, linear equations, and exact equations

Higher Order ODEs.description: Linear differential equations with constant coefficients

Systems of ODEs.description: Linear systems, phase portraits, and stability analysis

Partial Differential Equations.description: Heat equation, wave equation, and Laplace's equation

Counting Principles.description: Fundamental counting principle, permutations, and combinations

Graph Theory.description: Graph properties, trees, connectivity, and graph algorithms

Generating Functions.description: Ordinary and exponential generating functions for combinatorial problems

Extremal Combinatorics.description: Ramsey theory, extremal graph theory, and probabilistic methods
